thread.title: 200 years after Waterloo, Napoleon’s legend lives in Paris
thread.title_full: 200 years after Waterloo, Napoleon’s legend lives in Paris - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Rick Steves
title: 200 years after Waterloo, Napoleon’s legend lives in Paris
text:
Photo: Dominic Arizona Bonuccelli, Rick Steves' Europe print_article_embed|photo-8455279|article-6456658|7 comments_jump_embed|photo-8455279|article-6456658|1 email_share_embed|photo-8455279|article-6456658|1 facebook_share_embed|photo-8455279|article-6456658|2 twitter_share_embed|photo-8455279|article-6456658|3 pinterest_share_embed|photo-8455279|article-6456658|4 reddit_share_embed|photo-8455279|article-6456658|5 google_share_embed|photo-8455279|article-6456658|6 The dramatic Arc de Triomphe, built to honor Napoleon’s victories though finished posthumously, dominates Paris’ skyline day and night. The dramatic Arc de Triomphe, built to honor Napoleon’s victories...
Working on my TV shows and guidebooks in Europe, I try to get the straight story on history, but it can be tricky. I keep remembering Napoleon’s Quote: : “What is history but a myth agreed upon?” The 200th anniversary of the Battle of Waterloo prompted me to ponder the opportunities Paris offers to anyone who’d like to brush up on their Napoleonic facts. The dramatic Arc de Triomphe, built to honor Napoleon’s victories though finished posthumously, dominates Paris’ skyline day and night. The dramatic Arc de Triomphe, built to honor Napoleon’s victories...

I keep remembering Napoleon’s Quote: : “What is history but a myth agreed upon?” The 200th anniversary of the Battle of Waterloo prompted me to ponder the opportunities Paris offers to anyone who’d like to brush up on their Napoleonic facts.
